result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Truman Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances,  

No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent,

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, 

AODA and Follow up, 

DNA Sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Truman Curtis

records.addlTxt: to the Court from Defendant re: ATR etc

Case Called: 10:28 am
INCLUDES 22CF450 & 22CF421.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person; Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Adam Fontana in person.
VRCW.
PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 22CF450:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN BOTH FILES:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
22CF421:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>DRI.

22CF450:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC (>200-1000g)-Repeater)>> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling-Repeater)>> DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>> DRI.

PLEA: 
22CF450:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding. Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF450:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H -18 Months Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, AODA and Follow up, No Contact with Victim unless approved by agent, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 41 Days Credit. 

Adjourned: 10:42 am
Calendar call on May 31, 2022 at 08:05 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): G.A.F. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.

State appears by ADA Alex Lech for ADA Sidney Brubacher.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Heather Roehr, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 cash bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): G.A.F. and their residence.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
